intro: Dubrueilia crassifolia, commonly known as the thickleaf dubrueilia, is a member of the Malvaceae family, native to tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its thick, waxy leaves that are typically elliptical in shape and have a deep green color. The plant produces small, showy flowers that are usually pink or purple in color, arranged in clusters. It thrives in humid, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique morphology and ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
